I voted today for the unborn, the veterans, the basement dwellers, the Little Sisters of the Poor, the brave men deserted and murdered in Benghazi, the working poor, the unemployed and underemployed, the deplorables, the irredeemables, the backwards Catholics, the police officers, the firefighters, the armed forces, the tradesmen, the moms, the priests, the elderly, the students, and the teachers. I voted for those who can't or won't vote. I voted to uphold the Hyde Amendment. I voted for those who are afraid for the future of America and those who aren't afraid enough. I voted for religious freedom. I voted for the Constitution. I voted to drain the swamp. I voted for term limits. I voted to bust up government corruption. I voted for all those who get judged and written off for their past sins. I voted for the good husbands, fathers, loving grandfathers, and patriots who used to be crass youths with rotten judgment. I voted for the farmers and small business owners. I voted for those victimized by Obamacare's punitive costs. I voted for lower taxes. I voted to repeal the Johnson Amendment. I voted for better trade deals. I voted for Supreme Court justices who aren't leftist activists. I voted for jobs. I voted for the non-politician. I voted to banish political correctness. I voted, as a Registered Independent, for the candidate who has angered and frightened both parties' elites. I voted for the American Dream. I voted for law and order. I voted for the right to life. I voted for Donald J. Trump and Mike Pence. God bless America!

The Democratic party has made itself a sad joke. To rig a national election, to suppress American voters then get caught red handed, have the DNC head resign in disgrace, and within hours get hired by the Clinton campaign. This is the largest scandal in American history plain and simple. Well the Democratic party doubled down on what I consider a unelectable candidate none the less. It is my opinion that Hillary Clinton can not beat Donald Trump in election and rightfully so after shitting on our democracy. So with that say goodbye to democracy, to liberty and to the great nation we once knew. No self respecting person can vote for Hillary Clinton with the amount of fraud and scandals linked to her entire campaign. I'm not a religious man... but God save us all from these two presidential candidates. I am truly frightened and furious at the prospect of one of these two being elected president.
